column5: This is my story. The baby. The husband. The lack of affection and the prostitutes. My husband went further than yours though.

Take your time! Red flags are red flags. These arenâ€™t the worst of the sort but they are all the same things you donâ€™t do and where would they have gone if that girl hadnâ€™t contacted you. 

I met my husband at 23 and spent 9 months apart long distance and he didnâ€™t behave the way I expected him to but I was too insecure about myself to see that I should have been treated better so fair up to you that you can see that you are not to be treated badly. 

All the same - high ideals about others treating you as you would them may also be softened over time - by this I mean that people are people and are not all made of the same stuff and they do let each other down at times. 

....so time can show who you are and if he is the one for you.

Iâ€™m sorry that you had to go through this though, it sucks

So the lirker down-voted you for agreeing that he shouldnâ€™t comment on infidelity with no knowledge of cheating - heâ€™s a voyeur and wonâ€™t be able to take any other approach than staying on the fence. Thatâ€™s ok for him but he shouldnâ€™t advise others

Lurking on forums you have no business on is pretty low - and commenting in them is worse. People in here have been cheated on. Or have cheated on and are very sensitive to having people - essentially trolls - advising where they have no knowledge or empathy to advise.

When OP asks here itâ€™s to get people who can empathise whit the situations answer and NOT people who clearly canâ€™t.

In future maybe think before you post in these forums- you can do some real damage!

NTA he crossed a massive line - sucks. Sorry you had to first hand witness how some guys think they are â€˜nice guysâ€™ who can be creepy to people who have their trust. There were a lot better ways he could have made his interests known however if you are not interested in him after these 10 yrs that would prob still have made you feel ambushed.

Question is, whatâ€™s he worth to you? Is he a creep, really your friend after this, something more or none of the above.

Asking cos I once had a best friend for 8 years jump me when I was asleep - he got very pissed off when I woke up with him groping me and wasnâ€™t happy. It was before I realised how bad that shit was. We â€˜made upâ€™ and went on as before, in turn he got possessive and very upset when I about a year later hooked up with his step brother. I had no clue he wasnâ€™t over me and really he was a complete dick coining that term â€˜self entitled nice guyâ€™ before it was a thing. Neither of of us couldnâ€™t continue our friendship after that prob for the best.

I didnâ€™t the first time we had a baby and it went so fucking wrong resulting in me being hospitalised and my daughter being deprived of a mum for almost a year. 

...SO EVEN IF you were to think of your child first and not you, staying on your meds would be the right thing to do. Is what Iâ€™m trying to say.

your husband has to suck it up, you need to be a team and you need to be ok through a topsy turvy hormone roller coaster, your body changing and all that jazz. And you will be. But you ARE number one plain and simple

Think about it. We canâ€™t advise accurately based on OPs post. However it does sound very unhealthy all of it.

Itâ€™s dangerous to ask the internet if behaviour is justified - op has to decide for himself - take the risk and make up his mind. Maybe he is wrong to suspect cheating and cross boundaries, doesnâ€™t mean scenario isnâ€™t unhealthy. 

Iâ€™ve been cheated on. But Iâ€™ve also later accused a non-cheater of cheating and I crossed some boundaries I shouldnâ€™t have. How can we know which is which here if either. We canâ€™t. We canâ€™t say â€˜dude thatâ€™s totally justifiedâ€™ imho. Thatâ€™s all Iâ€™m saying.

Thatâ€™s subjective- The internet canâ€™t not know whatâ€™s actually happening other than OP perceives that it is - thatâ€™s all Iâ€™m saying.

We really cannot know or advise objectively. SOâ€™s actions could be perceived by OP or they could be actual. 

I had a time in my life when I was very jaloux and ruined two relationships by demanding to know movements and see phones and so on and accusing of non existing affairs. But On the other hand,  if SO turns out to actually be cheating and or is gaslighting OP then he was right to act accordingly. We canâ€™t know.

YTA, yes. On an overall the right thing to do and u understanding your husband and talking to him about what is going through scale. 

But â€˜the right thingâ€™ isnâ€™t  the best thing to do here if itâ€™s not the best for your family as a unit. sometimes itâ€™s ok to be an asshole, I have to be one to protect my family too at times - I have several chronic illnesses that means I canâ€™t handle what others can and that limits us all time and again when we say no to things that others dont. 

But my point is - itâ€™s legit to not want it, or be able to handle it and so on. And if watching out for your kids is your legit reason maybe thatâ€™s ok. And....make sure he is primary care giver too

But it does suck for his sister! And your husband. And thatâ€™s a trade off you have to live with! I really dont mean that in s shitty way.

Also remember that disabled people at also that, people, and lack of speech doesnâ€™t mean there isnâ€™t a person to get to know. Your husbands closest family and your kids aunt. There May ne Stuff to be gained here. Depending on the person that tour DIL is and how much she interacts when you know her Well.

Itâ€™s fine to say I wonâ€™t stand for your behaviourâ€™ but if my partner demanded to see my phone and went through my messages with my friends Iâ€™d cause real serious issues about boundaries and respect on my end. Then, I donâ€™t have anything to hide....
